items.sentence: We need to know everything there is to know about Tom.
Tom was on his way to the library when I ran into him.
Tom knew Mary wasn't likely to tell him what happened.
Tom thought Mary was the one who was going to do that.
Tom will have to ask Mary to do that for us, won't he?
The only flavor of ice cream that Tom eats is vanilla.
Tom is short, but he's still a good basketball player.
Are you telling me that you don't know how to do this?
Line a baking dish with thin slices of buttered bread.
There's a good chance that Tom won't get here on time.
There's not much chance that Tom will want to do that.
Why don't you have a try at convincing Tom to do that?
That's the way it works, and the only way it can work.
Tom already speaks French better than I speak English.
That's not the main reason that Tom shouldn't do that.
I know that someone in your position wouldn't do that.
I'd like to know what time you're planning to do that.
A person with a BMI of 30 or more is considered obese.
Tom banged on the door, hoping someone would hear him.
The man who broke into Tom's house stole Tom's violin.
If you leave right away, you should get there in time.
Mary took a picture of her mother with her cell phone.
Tom laughed so hard that he almost fell off his chair.
Tom participated in his city's annual polar bear swim.
Tom had a philosophical discussion with his professor.
Can you think of any reasons why we shouldn't do this?
I thought Tom said that he didn't want to get married.
I thought that I'd stop by and see how you were doing.
I'm glad that somebody told me what needed to be done.
Do you really think Tom could've done that by himself?
I finally understand the basic principles of calculus.
My favorite saying is "Two heads are better than one."
Tom was happy when I told him about what had happened.
Tom doesn't like corn dogs because they make him sick.
Tom's parents were mad that he didn't do his homework.
Tom promised Mary that he'd always be faithful to her.
If Tom doesn't get what he wants, he'll sulk and pout.
I'll need a magnifying glass to read this small print.
I've been keeping a diary in French for several years.
Many people became homeless because of the earthquake.
Have you ever taken part in this kind of event before?
You know you don't have to leave if you don't want to.
I hope my children get more breaks in life than I did.
I hope that these boots last longer than my last pair.
I hope that you're aware that nobody is above the law.
This movie is based on something that really happened.
If there were no telephones, it would be inconvenient.
Tom hired somebody to feed the dogs while he was away.
The dog picked up Tom's scent and we followed the dog.
I'll stop telling you what to do and mind my business.
